result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark J Bagniewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - Court grants defendant 7 days of jail credit.
- CASH BOND APPLIED. Fine and costs of $443.00 are PAID IN FULL.
- Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark J Bagniewski

records.addlTxt:
9:55 AM Defendant Mark J Bagniewski in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 21CM220 and 22CM18. Defendant states he will not be getting an attorney for these cases and would like to accept offer. DA Laspisa recites offer - in exchange for plea to one of the cases, State will dismiss and read in the other and will recommend fine and costs and DNA sample on the other case. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to 22CM18.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty as charged on 22CM18 and will dismiss and read in 21CM220. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

- 7 days jail. Court grants defendant 7 days jail credit.
- Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
- Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 


Court adjourned at  10:02 AM
Defendant called stating he did not receive the notice of hearing.  He was verbally given next court date/time and his address was confirmed. ads
Status hearing on September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:33 AM Defendant Mark J Bagniewski in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 21CM220 and 22CM18. Def does not have an attorney and has not received an offer. Statement by def, was not able to meet with the DA due to his work schedule. Court adjourns status hearing for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 AM. 

Court Adjourned 11:34 AM.
Status hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on August 2, 2022 at 11:15 am.

10:28 AM Defendant Mark J Bagniewski appeared by phone.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls both cases 2021CM220 and 2022CM18. Statement by defendant was not able to make the meeting yesterday. Statement by defendant. Court will set for Status Hearing on August 2, 2022 at 11:15 AM. Court quashes the warrants previously issued.

Court adjourned at 10:29 AM

10:24 AM Defendant Mark J Bagniewski not in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2921CM220 & 2022CM18. Court orders a warrant - stayed to the end of today if the defendant contacts the clerk's office otherwise issue warrant.

Court adjourned at 10:25 AM

Defendant called Clerk of Courts, stated he is working and not able to appear in person for his status hearing at 10:00 a.m. today, and he requested to appear via Zoom telephone. He was given the Zoom instructions. Defendant confirmed address on file is correct.
Status hearing on June 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:22 AM Defendant Mark J Bagniewski in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over discussion held before going on the record. Defendant will waive right to counsel to meet with the DA. Defendant concurs. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Court sets for Status Hearing on June 21, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 10:23 AM
Status hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Second appearance on May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:13 PM Defendant Mark J Bagniewski in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests an attorney and would like to save for an attorney and requests 3 months. Court sets for Status of counsel on May 24, 2022 at 10:00 AM. Corut goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one. Court informs defendant that if he hires an attorney, court may allow a portion of the bond to be used for the attorney's retainer.

Court adjourned at 3:14 PM
Second appearance scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bond Agency Payments
Bail Bond Deposit Acknowledgement
Status hearing on March 23, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark J Bagniewski
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 03-01-2022)
Prior: 336 Canal St, Princeton, WI 54968
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Warrant Cancelled - Spoke to Sam from Dispatch.
Warrant Cancelled - Spoke to Sam from Dispatch.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

1:12 PM Defendant Mark J Bagniewski appeared by video, in custody, Atty Michael Kapelis, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 21CM220 and 21CM18. Def has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Atty Kapelis makes bond recommendation. Court quashes warrants and sets bond at $500 cash bond for each case and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court will set for Status Hearing on March 23, 2022 at 3:15 PM.

Court adjourned at 1:16 PM.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant Mark J Bagniewski appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Michael Kapelis appeared by video for Mark J Bagniewski, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Due to technology issues, Court reschedules Return on Warrant to Feb 28, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
Sent to GLSO on January 26, 2022.
